meanings.definition: Cook by direct exposure to radiant heat.
meanings.sent1: I will broil the fish in the oven for dinner.
meanings.sent2: She likes to broil her steak for a delicious meal.
meanings.sent3: The sun seemed to broil everything in its path on the hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat from the fire seemed to broil the marshmallows in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The chef demonstrated how to broil the perfect burger during the cooking class.

meanings.definition: To be exposed to great heat.
meanings.sent1: The desert can broil under the scorching sun during the day.
meanings.sent2: The metal plate will broil in the blazing sun if left outside.
meanings.sent3: The cookies started to broil in the oven, filling the kitchen with a warm aroma.
meanings.sent4: The asphalt road seemed to broil under the midday sun, making it hard to walk on.
meanings.sent5: The campfire made the marshmallows broil to a perfect golden brown.

meanings.sent1: She tends to broil when someone interrupts her while she's working.
meanings.sent2: He will broil if you mention that topic around him.
meanings.sent3: The toddler started to broil when his toy was taken away from him.
meanings.sent4: The customer began to broil when his order was delayed at the restaurant.
meanings.sent5: The teacher could see the student starting to broil with frustration during the test.
